summary: In 2017, the National Weather Service started an effort to reform the agency and better prepare the U.S. for extreme weather events. It has established 20 reform initiatives, such as automating weather balloon launches, to free staff for other duties and improve service to emergency managers and others. We testified that the agency has largely followed leading reform practices, but it still has more to...
title: National Weather Service: Reform Efforts Could Benefit from Additional Actions and Continued Attention
